quizlist.question: What is a treatment for traumatic shock?
quizlist.option3: Open clothing cooling of the body.

quizlist.question: What first, second, and third degree burns are classified according to?
quizlist.option3: Source of heat causing the burn.

quizlist.question: What is an emergency life-saving procedure that consists of recognizing and correcting failure of the respiratory or cardiovascular systems?
What would you do if a person gets something in his or her eye and you see that it is not embedded?
quizlist.option1: Remove it with a moist, cotton-tipped applicator.
quizlist.option2: Get them to rub their eye until the object is gone.
quizlist.option3: Remove it with a piece of dry sterile cotton.

quizlist.question: If there is a possibility of confusion, which signal should be used to send the group 'True Bearing 045 Degrees'?
A crew member has suffered frostbite to the toes of both feet. What should you do?
quizlist.option1: Immerse the feet in warm water.
quizlist.option2: Warm the feet with a heat lamp.
quizlist.option3: Warm the feet at room temperature.

quizlist.question: What should you do when a crew member is unconscious and the face is flushed?
quizlist.option1: Lay the crew member down with the head and shoulders slightly raised.
quizlist.option3: Lay the crew member down with the head lower than the feet.

quizlist.question: A crew member suddenly becomes blind in both eyes.  Which code should your message contain?
A man has a burn on his arm. There is reddening of the skin, blistering, and swelling. What burn is this using standard medical terminology?
A man has suffered a burn on the arm. There is a reddening of the skin but no other apparent damage. What burn is this using standard MEDICAL terminology?
A man has suffered a burn on the arm. There is extensive damage to the skin with charring present. How is this injury classified using standard medical terminology?
A message giving warning of a hurricane should have which prefix when sent by radiotelephone?
A package contains nitric acid solution and is radioactive. The radiation level at the package surface is .36 millirems per hour. How should this package be labeled?
A patient in shock should NOT be placed in which position?
quizlist.option2: Flat on their back with head and feet at the same level.
quizlist.option3: Head down and feet up, no injuries to face or head.

quizlist.question: Why should a person being treated for shock should be wrapped in warm coverings?
quizlist.option3: Avoid self-inflicted wounds caused by spastic movement.

quizlist.question: A person has suffered a laceration of the arm. Severe bleeding has been controlled by using a sterile dressing and direct pressure. What should you do next?
quizlist.option1: Apply a pressure bandage over the dressing.
quizlist.option2: Apply a tourniquet to prevent the bleeding from restarting.
quizlist.option3: Remove any small foreign matter and apply antiseptic.

quizlist.question: What should be done to a person suffering from possible broken bones and internal injuries?
quizlist.option1: Not be moved but made comfortable until medical assistance arrives.
quizlist.option2: Not be allowed to lie down where injured but moved to a chair or bunk.
quizlist.option3: Be examined then walked to a bunk.

quizlist.question: A petroleum liquid has a flash point of 135°Fahrenheit. How this liquid is classed as a grade?
Where in the pulse to check where a rescuer can most easily determine whether or not an adult victim has a pulse?
A shipmate chokes suddenly, cannot speak, and starts to turn blue. What should you do?
quizlist.option2: Make the victim lie down with the feet elevated to get blood to the brain.

quizlist.question: What would precede to a signal indicating Greenwich mean time?
quizlist.option1: A code hoist to indicate Greenwich mean time to follow.

quizlist.question: When and only when does a tourniquet should be used to control bleeding?
quizlist.option1: When all other means have failed.

quizlist.question: What immediately followed does a vessel in distress should send by radio telephone the two tone alarm signal?
A victim has suffered a second-degree burn to a small area of the lower arm. What is the proper treatment for this injury?
quizlist.option1: Immerse the arm in cold water for 1 to 2 hours, apply burn ointment, and bandage.
quizlist.option2: Open any blisters with a sterile needle, apply burn ointment and bandage.
quizlist.option3: Apply burn ointment, remove any foreign material and insure that nothing is in contact with the burn.

quizlist.question: A victim is coughing and wheezing from a partial obstruction of the airway. What an observer should do?
quizlist.option1: Allow the person to continue coughing and dislodge the obstruction on his own.
quizlist.option2: Give back blows and something to drink.

quizlist.question: What should your radiotelephone log must contain according to the 'Vessel Bridge-to-Bridge Radiotelephone Act'?
quizlist.option1: A summary of all distress calls and messages.
quizlist.option2: The home address of the vessel's Master or owner.
quizlist.option3: A record of your transmissions only.

quizlist.question: According to the Chemical Data Guide, propylene oxide is assigned a health hazard rating of 3,2,2. What does the last digit '2' of the rating means?
quizlist.option1: The chemical poison presents some hazard if it enters the body and typically has threshold limits of 100 to 500 ppm.
quizlist.option2: The chemical is severely hazardous, usually having threshold limits below 10 ppm.
quizlist.option3: The chemical contains fairly severe skin irritants, causing second- and third-degree burns after a few minutes contact.

quizlist.question: According to the Chemical Data Guide, what flash point (degrees F) of fuel oil number 6 has?
According to the Chemical Data Guide, what is NOT a recommended extinguishing agent for an ethyl chloride fire?
